info.author: Sean Reifschneider
info.description:
Cracklib is great, and in newer packages there is a Python module available
for it. However, on systems that don't yet have it, such as CentOS 5, I've
written a ctypes wrapper for the system cryptlib. This would also work on a
system that you can't install python-libcrypt. It does require python with
ctypes available, so for CentOS 5 you have to install and use the python26
package.
info.name: ctypescracklib
info.summary: ctypes wrapper for cracklib password strength checking
info.html_description: Cracklib is great, and in newer packages there is a Python module available for it. However, on systems that don’t yet have it, such as CentOS 5, I’ve written a ctypes wrapper for the system cryptlib. This would also work on a system that you can’t install python-libcrypt. It does require python with ctypes available, so for CentOS 5 you have to install and use the python26 package.
